Version 1.25.0 Customizable Output

This release brings the very basic first customizability to the output of ppl’s commands. As of this version, it’s possible to pass a --format option to ppl email and ppl ls to specify the exact nature of the output required. Also part of this new version is the ability to configure preset format strings for ppl ls in ~/.pplconfig and invoke them by name using the --pretty option.

Obviously, this type of functionality has the potential to be added to just about all of ppl’s output. In time, that will happen. For now, this gets the basic functionality out there for use.
